quiz.title: Line of Best Fit Analysis
quiz.subtitle: Unit 5 Quiz 10: Finding the Best-Fit Line for Data Sets
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Linear Regression and Best-Fit Line Estimation

questions.question: What is a line of best fit?
options: A line that minimizes the distance from all data points
A line that passes through every data point
A line that connects the first and last data points
A line that is always horizontal
questions.explanation: A line of best fit (or trend line) is a straight line that best represents the data on a scatter plot by minimizing the sum of squared distances from points to the line.

questions.question: Based on the scatter plot, which line appears to be the best fit?
questions.explanation: Line C follows the general trend of the data, with roughly equal numbers of points above and below it, and minimizes overall distance from points.

questions.question: Estimate the equation of the best-fit line shown. Coordinates approximate: (1,2), (3,5), (4,6), (6,9)
questions.explanation: Visual estimation: Points roughly follow linear pattern. Slope appears about 1.4, y-intercept about 0.5. $y \approx 1.4x + 0.5$ fits the trend.

questions.question: Which scatter plot shows the strongest linear relationship for a best-fit line?
questions.explanation: Plot B shows points closely clustered around a straight line, indicating strong linear correlation suitable for a reliable best-fit line.

questions.question: Using the estimated best-fit line, predict y when x=5.
questions.explanation: From the graph, best-fit line appears to pass near (0,1) and (8,13). Slope ≈ 12/8 = 1.5. Equation: y ≈ 1.5x + 1. When x=5: y ≈ 1.5(5)+1 = 8.5.

questions.question: What does the slope of a best-fit line represent in real data?
questions.explanation: The slope represents the average rate of change: how much y changes for each unit increase in x. In context, it shows the relationship strength and direction.

questions.question: Estimate the correlation from this scatter plot.
questions.explanation: Points show upward trend: as x increases, y generally increases. This indicates positive correlation.

questions.question: Which best-fit line equation might fit this negative correlation?
questions.explanation: Graph shows downward trend (negative slope). y-intercept appears around 10, slope negative. $y \approx -0.8x + 10$ fits this pattern.

questions.question: If a best-fit line has equation y = 2.3x + 1.7, what does the y-intercept 1.7 represent?
questions.explanation: The y-intercept (1.7) represents the predicted value of y when x = 0, based on the trend in the data.

questions.question: Which statement about best-fit lines is true?
options: It may not pass through any actual data points
It must pass through the first data point
It must pass through as many data points as possible
It is the same as connecting all dots
questions.explanation: A best-fit line minimizes overall error; it often doesn't pass through any specific data point but represents the overall trend.

scoreMessages.90: Exceptional! You master line of best fit concepts: estimation, interpretation, correlation, and real-world meaning of slope/intercept.
scoreMessages.70: Strong analytical skills! Focus on visual estimation accuracy and interpreting slope/y-intercept in context.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice: 1) Estimating slope from scatter plots, 2) Distinguishing positive/negative/no correlation, 3) Understanding what best-fit represents.
scoreMessages.0: Start with identifying correlation: upward trend = positive, downward = negative, random = no correlation. Best-fit line follows the trend direction.
